Hi John, the T=F4s=F4 Kod=F4gu Meiji Taikai has about 8 pages of Somin's me=
i. 
Your image looks ok from what I can see but it is just too small to tel=
l 
really. Any chance of adding an image of the mei and Kao ?.

Rich Turner=




Dr John P Lissenden wrote:

> Dear colleagues
>
> Working on the assump=
tion that any kodogu signed Somin is almost
> certainly gimei, I should be =
interested in your comments on the
> kodzuka in my photo album JPL.  It dep=
icts, on a polished copper
> ground, Shoki mounted on a shishi.  The single=
 image is rendered on
> both surfaces in a skillful katakiri-bori, and is c=
ontinuous across
> both edges of the kodzuka.
>
> It is inscribed on the re=
verse SOMIN with kao, and also bears the
> inscription GIONEN ROKUSU ROKUSA=
I (aged 66 years old).
>
> It is ex the Peak and Gardiner collections, havi=
ng been purchased by
> its previous owner in 1948.
>
> Any and all comments=
 will be most gratefully received.
>
> Regards, JPL.
>
